meta.note: Step-by-step onboarding. Do not render all steps. Follow 'next' chaining only.

intro.title: 👋 Welcome to Orchestrate
intro.narration: You’re now inside Orchestrate — your command center for tasks, notes, and file tools. Let’s walk through how it works.

step_1.title: 📂 Load Your Workspace
step_1.narration: We’ll start by loading your workspace — tasks and saved items.

step_2.title: ✏️ Create Your First Task
step_2.narration: What’s something you need to remember or take action on? Let’s save your first task.
step_2.prompt: What task should I remember for you?

step_3.title: 📓 Open Your Notes
step_3.narration: Your notes live here. I’ve already dropped in a few sample entries that explain how the notes system works — no setup required.

step_4.title: 🧠 Save Your First Note
step_4.narration:
Let’s explore how notes work in Orchestrate. 🧠 Notes are your system-wide scratchpad — ideal for insights, ideas, or things you want to remember later. You don’t need to organize them manually — I’ll help you retrieve or connect them using tags and search.

Now — what’s something you just realized or learned? I’ll save it as your first note.
step_4.prompt: Type any new idea you want to capture:

step_5.title: 📥 Drop a File Into the Drop Zone
step_5.narration:
Let’s explore your **Drop Zone** — a special folder Orchestrate watches for new content.

🗂 You’ll find it at:
**~/Documents/Orchestrate/dropzone**

You can drop any `.txt` or `.md` file in there — tasks, old notes, journal entries, project outlines, even transcripts. Think of it like **Dropbox on steroids**.

🔹 Orchestrate can **read and search** any file in this folder.
🔹 But treat it as your **important workspace inbox**, not a junk drawer.

📌 Please drop in at least one file before continuing — we’ll use it next.
step_5.prompt: Let me know when you’ve dropped a file into your Drop Zone and we’ll continue.

step_6.title: 🔍 Scan the Drop Zone
step_6.narration: Great — now let’s scan the Drop Zone for what you’ve added.

step_7.title: 📖 Read a File
step_7.narration: Let’s open one of the files from your Drop Zone.

step_8.title: 🧠 Save an Insight from the File
step_8.narration: Want to capture something from that file? I’ll log it instantly.
step_8.prompt: What insight do you want to save?

step_9.title: 🔮 Predict Your Future
step_9.narration: Let’s play MASH — the legendary game that predicts your future. You choose the options, and I’ll spin the wheel.
step_9.prompt:
List 4 options for each: 
- Where you might live (e.g. Mansion, Apartment...)
- What you might drive (e.g. Tesla, Bike...)
- Dream jobs (e.g. Astronaut, DJ...)
- Life partners (real or fictional)

Then pick a number from 1–10 for the spin.

step_10.title: 🎁 Refer a Friend — Add to the System
step_10.narration: Want to refer someone? Just give me their name and email, and I’ll log it to `referrals.json` so they can be invited and both of you unlock tools.
step_10.prompt: Enter the name and email of the person you'd like to refer (e.g. John Smith, john@example.com):

step_11.title: 🪙 Unlock a New Tool
step_11.narration:
🎉 You’ve now completed your core setup.

🟢 You’ve also been granted **3 unlock credits**.

You can use them to unlock tools like Outline Editor, Buffer Engine, Blog Assembler, and more — no referrals needed.
step_11.prompt: Would you like to see what tools are available to unlock now?

outro.title: ✅ You’re Set Up
outro.narration: You’ve created a task, saved a note, added a file, captured insight, predicted your future, referred someone, and explored unlocks. Your Orchestrate workspace is now live.
